ЁЯСС
Vasumitra

Vasumitra, son of Agnimitra, was a skilled warrior. Kalidasa's 'Malavikagnimitram' mentions that he defeated the Yavanas (Greeks) on the banks of the Sindhu River while protecting the horse of his grandfather Pushyamitra's Ashwamedha sacrifice.

ЁЯПЫя╕П
Bhagabhadra and Heliodorus

The reign of the Shunga king Bhagabhadra (son of Kashi) is known for diplomatic relations. The Indo-Greek king Antialcidas of Taxila sent Heliodorus as his ambassador to his court (Vidisha). Heliodorus embraced the Bhagavata faith and erected the famous 'Garuda Pillar' (Besnagar Pillar) in honor of Lord Vishnu (Vasudeva).

ЁЯУЙ
Devabhuti and Fall

Devabhuti was the last ruler of the Shunga dynasty. He is described as a weak and decadent king. Around 73 BCE, his own Brahman minister Vasudeva Kanva assassinated him through a conspiracy and seized power.
